com.percussion.xml
Class PSXmlTreeWalker

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.xml.PSXmlTreeWalker
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSXmlTreeWalker
public class PSXmlTreeWalker
extends Object
implements Serializable

The PSXmlTreeWalker class is used to simplify processing of XML trees. It is a generic walker used to easily find top level elements, child elements and their children.

To use the PSXmlTreeWalker, construct a walker for the XML document. The walker can then be used to search for entries, retrieve a subset of the document, etc. This greatly simplifies processing results, as XML documents can contain fairly complex structures.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

RELATIVE_NODENAME_ROOT

public static final String RELATIVE_NODENAME_ROOT
The header which can be used to get a node using the relative position of the root. Simply append the node name under the root to this name. For instance, to get the first node named "data" from the root, use RELATIVE_NODENAME_ROOT + "data", which resolves to "/data".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RELATIVE_NODENAME_PARENT

public static final String RELATIVE_NODENAME_PARENT
The header which can be used to get a node using the relative position of the parent. Simply append the node name under the parent to this name. For instance, to get the first node named "data" from the parent of the current node, use RELATIVE_NODENAME_PARENT + "data", which resolves to "../data".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RELATIVE_NODENAME_CURRENT

public static final String RELATIVE_NODENAME_CURRENT
The header which can be used to get a node using the relative position of the current node. Simply append the node name under the current node to this name. For instance, to get the first node named "data" from the current node, use RELATIVE_NODENAME_CURRENT + "data", which resolves to "./data". This is not really required, as "data" is also sufficient to find the appropriate child of the current node.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

XML_ELEMENT_DELIMITER

public static final String XML_ELEMENT_DELIMITER
The delimiter used to separate XML elements in an XPath expression.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Method Detail

getElementData

public String getElementData(String name,
                             boolean fromRoot)
Get the value (data) associated with an element, optionally starting the search for the element from the root node.

A subset of the XSL positioning rules are supported. When fromRoot is false, relative positioning can be used from the current node (./) or from the current node's parent (../). Attribute names can be located by preceeding the attribute name with @. Also, the tree can be traversed hierarchically to access children, such as ./Name/first to access the data associated with the first which is a child of the Name element which is a child of the current node.

Parameters:
name - the name of the element to retrieve
fromRoot - true to start the search from the root element; false to start from the current element in the tree
Returns:
the value of the element or null if a matching element is not found

getElementData

public String getElementData(String name)
Get the value (data) associated with an element. The search for a matching element will start from the root node.

Parameters:
name - the name of the element to retrieve
Returns:
the value of the element or null if a matching element is not found

getElementData

public String getElementData()
Gets the text data associated with the current node of this walker, by concatenating the values of all child TEXT_NODEs and ENTITY_REFERENCE_NODEs.

Returns:
text data of the node; never null, may be empty if the current node has no text data.

getElementData

public static String getElementData(Element element)
Get the value (text data) associated with the specified element. If the specified element is null or has no text data, returns the empty string.

Parameters:
element - the element to retrieve data from
Returns:
the value of the element, never null may be empty if the specified element is null or has no text data.

getElementData

public static String getElementData(Node node)
Get the value (text data) associated with the specified node. If the specified node is null or has no text data, returns the empty string.

Parameters:
node - the element or entity ref node to retrieve the data from, if it is null, returns an empty string.
Returns:
the value of the element, never null may be empty if the specified element is null or has no text data.

getNextElement

public Element getNextElement(String name)
Get the next element with the specified name. This method will traverse parents if it cannot find siblings or children with the specified name. Use getNextElement(name, true) to only traverse siblings and children.

Parameters:
name - the name of the element to retrieve
Returns:
the requested Element node

getNext

public Node getNext()
Get the next node in the tree. This may be at any level. The search is done by walking down each child, and then across siblings and their associated children.

Returns:
the next Node in the tree

Returns:
the next Node in the tree

write

public void write(Writer out,
                  boolean indentFlag,

                  boolean omitDocumentType)
           throws IOException
Write the tree associated with this walker, calls write(out, indentFlag, omitXMLDeclaration, omitDocumentType, "UTF-8")

Throws:
IOException

write

public void write(Writer out,
                  boolean indentFlag,
                  boolean omitXMLDeclaration,
                  boolean omitDocumentType,
                  String encoding)
           throws IOException
Write the tree associated with this walker to the specified stream.

Parameters:
out - the output stream to write to. May not be null. This method does not close the output stream.
indentFlag - controls whether the output is indentented or written as a continuous stream. See OutputKeys.INDENT for more information about indentation behavior. Most uses of this method should pass true to have this routine indent.
omitXMLDeclaration - If true then the output will not contain a standard xml header.
omitDocumentType - If true then the output will definitely not include a DOCTYPE declaration. If false then the DOCTYPE and any contained references will be dependent on the contents of the document. Note that inline DOCTYPE declarations will always be included as they are simply processing instructions in the document structure.
encoding - The encoding to use for the output file, may be null or empty. Defaults to "UTF-8".
Throws:
IOException

getLowestLevelElement

public static String getLowestLevelElement(List elements)
Get the lowest level element from the specified lists. This is used to determine which node can be used as an iterator over the tree.

Parameters:
elements - a list containing the String names of the elements to examine
Returns:
the name of the node to use as the iterator (may be null)

getBaseElement

public static String getBaseElement(String currentBase,
                                    String xmlField)
Get the common base of the two supplied xpath strings.

Parameters:
currentBase - the current base element, an xpath String that may be null or empty.
xmlField - the xml field element, an xpath String that may be null or empty.
Returns:
the common base element found for the supplied xpath strings, may be null or empty. If the supplied current base is null or empty, the xml field is returned. If the supplied xml field is null empty, the current base will be returned.

getRelativeFieldName

public static String getRelativeFieldName(String base,
                                          String xmlField)
Get the relative XML field name for the specified field using the specified base. If the fields are unrelated, xmlField will be returned untouched.

Parameters:
base - the base to use for the relative field name
xmlField - the XML field to be converted
Returns:
the relative XML field name

Get the root node name from the specified XML field.

Parameters:
name - the XML field name
Returns:
the root node name or null if name is null or empty

convertToXmlEntities

public static void convertToXmlEntities(String input,
                                        Writer out)
                                 throws IOException
A private utility method to convert special characters to entity references. The characters will be converted according to this scheme:
& &amp;
< &lt;
> &gt;
' &apos;
" &quot;

Parameters:
input -
Throws:
IOException - if I/O error occurs.

convertToXmlEntities

public static void convertToXmlEntities(String input,
                                        PrintWriter out)
Just like convertToXmlEntities(String, Writer), except this suppress the IOException.

convertToXmlEntities

public static String convertToXmlEntities(String input)
A private utility method to convert special characters to entity references. The characters will be converted according to this scheme:
& &amp;
< &lt;
> &gt;
' &apos;
" &quot;

Parameters:
input -
Returns:
String A new String with all special characters transformed into their entities.
